parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the content (this is part of the request uri, e.g. /4/content/{content_id})

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the content (value is one of an enum, possible values are [BRAND, SERIES, ITEM, EPISODE, FILM, SONG, CLIP].

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The publisher for the content.

parameters.name: aliases.namespace
parameters.description: Return all topics with an alias namespace equal to the provided value.

parameters.name: aliases.value
parameters.description: Return all topics with an alias value equal to the provided value.

parameters.name: topics.topic.id
parameters.description: Match all content whose topics contain a topic with the given id.

parameters.name: topics.relationship
parameters.description: Match all content whose topics contain a topic with the given relationship.

parameters.name: topics.supervised
parameters.description: Match all content whose topics contain a topic with the given supervised boolean.

parameters.name: topics.weighting
parameters.description: Match all content whose topics contain a topic with the given supervised boolean.

parameters.name: annotations
parameters.description: List of annotations that describe the data to be output.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the channel (this is part of the request uri, e.g. /4/schedule/{channel_id})

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Date to start your schedule request from. can be an ISO DateTime or relative, e.g. 'now.plus.6h'.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Date to end your schedule request. can be an ISO DateTime or relative, e.g. 'now.plus.6h'.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The publisher of the schedule.

parameters.name: annotations
parameters.description: List of annotations that describe the data to be output.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the topic (this is part of the request uri, e.g. /4/topics/{topic_id})

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the topic (value is one of an enum, possible values are [SUBJECT, PERSON, PLACE, ARTIST, EVENT, PRODUCT, WORK, UNKNOWN].

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The publisher for the topic.

parameters.name: aliases.namespace
parameters.description: Return all topics with an alias namespace equal to the provided value.

parameters.name: aliases.value
parameters.description: Return all topics with an alias value equal to the provided value.

parameters.name: annotations
parameters.description: List of annotations that describe the data to be output.
